intro: Palicourea brenesii, commonly known as the Guatemalan moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It is a climbing shrub native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Guatemala and Mexico. The plant has opposite, simple, and usually ovate to elliptic leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with white or pale yellow petals. Palicourea brenesii is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local herbal remedies.
